Definition: The simulation of human intelligence processes by machines.
A subset of AI that allows systems to learn from data.
A subset of ML that uses multi-layered neural networks to analyze data.
A type of ML where the model is trained using labeled data.
A type of ML where the model learns from unlabelled data.
A type of ML that focuses on how agents take actions in an environment to maximize rewards.
Computational models inspired by the human brain that are used for pattern recognition.
A field of AI that focuses on the interaction between computers and humans through natural language.
A field of AI that enables computers to interpret and understand visual information from the world.
A modeling error that occurs when a model is too complex, capturing noise instead of the underlying pattern.
